channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 5 takeaways from the 2025 elections. And, the shutdown now the longest in U.S. history
item.description: The 2025 elections were good to Democrats with wins in several major races, including governor's races in two states. And, the ongoing government shutdown is now the longest in U.S. history.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 elections were good to Democrats with wins in several major races, including governor's races in two states. And, the ongoing government shutdown is now the longest in U.S. history.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: FEMA promised funds to tsunami-proof an Oregon hospital. That money is MIA
item.description: The federal government promised an Oregon hospital millions of dollars to help prepare for an earthquake. They're still waiting for the money.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government promised an Oregon hospital millions of dollars to help prepare for an earthquake. They're still waiting for the money.

(Image credit: Jay Fram for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Prosecutors seize yachts, luxury cars from man accused of running Cambodia cyberscams
item.description: Prosecutors in Taiwan, Hong Kong and Singapore seized hundreds of millions of dollars in assets belonging to a Cambodian businessman whom the U.S. accuses of heading a global scam syndicate.
item.content:encoded:
Prosecutors in Taiwan, Hong Kong and Singapore seized hundreds of millions of dollars in assets belonging to a Cambodian businessman whom the U.S. accuses of heading a global scam syndicate.

(Image credit: Ministry of Justice Investigation Bureau)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How an enduring debate over healthcare sparked a now record-long shutdown
item.description: At the heart of the impasse is a debate about expiring subsidies for health insurance. It's the latest chapter in a fight over Obamacare that has dominated Congress since the law was signed in 2010.
item.content:encoded:
At the heart of the impasse is a debate about expiring subsidies for health insurance. It's the latest chapter in a fight over Obamacare that has dominated Congress since the law was signed in 2010.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Yes, Trump's tariffs are raising billions -- but at a steep economic cost
item.description: Trump's tariffs are raising tens of billions of dollars for the federal government. They're also costing consumers, frustrating businesses and hurting the factories they're supposed to help.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's tariffs are raising tens of billions of dollars for the federal government. They're also costing consumers, frustrating businesses and hurting the factories they're supposed to help.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Iowa doesn't have enough OB-GYNs. Is the state's abortion ban part of the problem?
item.description: Iowa ranks last among states for the number of OB-GYNS per capita. State legislators are trying to recruit more, but some doctors say the state's strict abortion ban is partially to blame.
item.content:encoded:
Iowa ranks last among states for the number of OB-GYNS per capita. State legislators are trying to recruit more, but some doctors say the state's strict abortion ban is partially to blame.

(Image credit: Natalie Krebs)
item.dc:creator: Natalie Krebs

item.title: Here are 6 'Beautiful Bill' tax changes that will benefit wealthy Americans
item.description: Tax season is approaching. Tax breaks that were extended as part of President Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill" will mainly benefit high-net-worth and high-income people.
item.content:encoded: Tax season is approaching. Tax breaks that were extended as part of President Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill" will mainly benefit high-net-worth and high-income people.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Supreme Court enters the lion's den on Trump tariffs
item.description: The case has potentially profound economic consequences for the country and the presidency.
item.content:encoded:
The case has potentially profound economic consequences for the country and the presidency.

(Image credit: Jabin Botsford)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Air traffic controllers warn of 'tipping point' as U.S. government shutdown drags on
item.description: The government shutdown is taking a growing toll on air traffic controllers who are working without pay. Staffing shortages led to big delays over the weekend, raising concerns about travel chaos.
item.content:encoded:
The government shutdown is taking a growing toll on air traffic controllers who are working without pay. Staffing shortages led to big delays over the weekend, raising concerns about travel chaos.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Democrats had a big night. Here are 5 takeaways from the 2025 elections
item.description: Democrats had a good night, winning major races including governor's races in Virginia and New Jersey and a redistricting ballot measure in California, while also confronting the future of the party.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats had a good night, winning major races including governor's races in Virginia and New Jersey and a redistricting ballot measure in California, while also confronting the future of the party.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro
